data: NIA Acute Mild to Moderate Pain (Adult)
Status
Nurse Independent Activities
Refer to Clinical Practice Document: Pain Management: Acute Mild to Moderate Pain (Adult age 17 years and older)
Patient Care
Use a standardized pain scale, such as verbal rating scale (0 to 10) or faces pain scale
Acute Mild or Moderate Pain (pain scale 0-7 out of 10)
Medications
Acetaminophen and ibuprofen can be administered concomitantly per client preference / experience
Acetaminophen lower dosage e.g. 325 to 650 mg may be administered per client preference / experience and / or special considerations e.g. history of hepatic or renal impairment
acetaminophen
650 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
975 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
325 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
OR
acetaminophen
650 mg, rectal, once, drug form: supp, first dose: NOW
Select ibuprofen if acetaminophen evaluated to be inappropriate or ineffective, unless contraindicated or if special considerations exist
ibuprofen
200 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
400 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
Communication Orders
Notify Treating Provider
Or Nurse Practitioner to obtain ongoing orders as indicated
